Job description

Location:\xa0


  • Melbourne - Eastern Suburbs
\xa0

Work Type:\xa0


  • 1 Year Contract


About the Company

  • Local Council

About the Role

  • Plan, design, implement and document workflow processes varying in levels of complexity (eg automation of manual workflows).
  • Develop test plan specifications, test and debug processes according to plan.
  • Evaluate existing and new Council applications to assess integration approach.
  • Recommend best practices for implementing, managing, and governing integrations using the Boomi AtomSphere integration platform.
  • Design and Implement MDM and API Management.


About You


  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or relevant experience.
  • 5+ years of development experience.
  • 2+ years of integration development experience preferably using Dell Boomi or another enterprise integration platform in commercial environment for both on-premise and Cloud hosted applications. If you don't have DELL Boomi experience, there is an opportunity to learn it.
  • Expertise in API Management and MDM master data management suite.
  • Strong understanding of enterprise application integration patterns, component reusability.
  • Expertise in the assessment, architectural design, and implementation of integration patterns including Middleware, Bulk Data Integration, Real-Time Data Integrations, File Based Integrations, Cloud Integrations, Process Integrations, ETL, and Event Processing.
  • Relational database experience using SQL Server and ETL processes using SSIS.
  • Demonstrated experience of designing REST and SOA based Web Services.
  • API Design tools/languages (such as RAML, Swagger, Postman) and strong understanding of building Micro Services.


The Benefits


  • 1 Year contract (Daily Rate)
  • Large transformation project
  • Melbourne Eastern Suburbs

Client Engagement Manager

Company Name Big Cloud Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 73 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you passionate about the advancement of AI? Are you a creative, bright Data Scientist with deep commercial understanding? Are you able to translate complex business problems into simple solutions?>


A highly successful tech start-up with offices in New York, London Singapore, Sydney and Melbourne. They implement a proprietary AI-powered research engine, capable of finding extremely complex patterns in data. This is an award-winning and ground-breaking solution, being used by Fortune 500 companies in many different sectors.


Engagement Managers are the strategic pillars for any project. Working across countless industries and domains, you would support clients and \xa0in-house data scientists by providing an end to end partnership, thus enabling both to focus on maximizing revolutionary discoveries and driving the most business value from them.


What will you do?


● Be the ambassador to clients; engaging with clients to convert intent and driving ongoing impact.

● Drive active usage of the AI-platform; able to measure impact and encourage further uptake or optimisation.

● Establish and maintain long-term relationships with client partners, sharing their vision and need and leading them towards impact.

● Translate business needs and initiatives into internal guidelines and roadmaps for stakeholders - i.e., \xa0planning, benefits tracking, reporting, presentation, stakeholder engagement etc.

● Support Data Scientists before, during and after engagements, providing guidance and context, program and project management, and an escalation path to senior clients.

● Develop KPI, business review and scorecard models to assess current business practices and provide innovative approaches for improved efficiency and effectiveness.


What will you need?


● Experience in direct client management, e.g., at a software company, digital agency, or management consultancy

● Management Degree required

● Excellent verbal and written English

● Experience in establishing continuous and fruitful business relationships

● Thorough understanding of how data-driven decision making transforms a product or business

● Understanding of how analytics organizations operate within an Fortune 500 organization

● Strong technical aptitude and attention to detail; can confidently project manage a technical project with many moving pieces


Why this opportunity?


Work on a cutting-edge, AI platform, that is rapidly changing how banks, insurers, governments, hospitals, charities, ecommerce unicorns, oil conglomerates (and many, many more) understand and react to their data.

Work with award-winning Data Scientists, Engineers and thought-leaders that come from a host of top-tier companies and academic institutions.

Choose your projects and where you want to leave a mark.

Have the opportunity for pro bono engagements, helping NGO's that are working on causes that you care about.

Be part of an organisation that develops and invests in its people and believes in helping them to get to where they want to be.


Big Cloud is a Machine Learning recruiting firm. We’re lucky enough to recruit the best candidates into the most exciting companies all over the world.

\xa0

We try to reply to all unsuccessful applications, but we’re human (for now). \xa0

\xa0

Check out www.bigcloud.io/hotjobs to see what else we're recruiting for

Office Manager & People Operations Lead

Company Name Bolster Group Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 222 views

Job description

We’re a digital strategy, creative and product agency specialising in music, events and entertainment. We’re incredibly passionate about our clients and, hopefully, they’re on your radar too! We’re talking teams like Splendour in the Grass, St. Jerome’s Laneway Festival, Falls Festival, Chugg Entertainment, Fairfax Events and Future Classic, plus global lifestyle brands such as YouTube, JBL and Blundstone.
\xa0

Our diverse and energetic team is growing fast and we’re on the hunt for someone super organised to take the office management reigns. Your job will be to keep everything moving. You’ll be two steps ahead at all times, intuitively taking care of the details, so the team can focus on the stuff they do best.
\xa0

If you have the ability to make order out of chaos while remaining calm and flexible with ever-changing priorities and needs, then this is the role for you.

\xa0

The Role:
\xa0

You’ll act as the office ambassador, ensuring all team members have what they need to be productive. That includes:

  • Keep the office running like clockwork and looking great.
  • Organise company events and outings, from Friday afternoon drinks to staff retreats.
  • Assist with meeting scheduling and make travel arrangements for the team.
  • Manage office supplies and vendor / service provider agreements
  • Assist with the onboarding and setup of new staff.
  • Champion the Bolster brand by assisting with culture initiatives.
  • Assist finance manager with basic bookkeeping duties
  • Act as assistant to the directors

\xa0

Requirements
  • Formidable organisation skills - people fear your lists and spreadsheets.
  • Ability to communicate clearly with all levels of internal and external stakeholders.
  • Understand the need for confidentiality and discretion.
  • An unshakeable efficiency and adaptability to change - ours is a fast-paced environment!
  • A lateral thinker, with an ability to create and manage processes.
  • A positive, cheerful and calm demeanour that sets the tone.
  • Solid proficiency in microsoft excel, google docs, email and task management software (ie: Asana, trello)
  • Apply a proactive approach to getting things done.
  • At least one year experience in a similar role within a creative/digital/music business.

851378673:
[

Property Accountant

Company Name The GPT Group Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 98 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Do you want to work for a Top 50 ASX listed business that is transforming the property market of Australia?

At GPT we are passionate about creating spaces that go beyond the expectations of our investors, customers and communities. We create value through our focus on strategic investment and management of high quality shopping centres, office towers, logistics centres and business parks and proudly own a number of prime assets across Australia. Every day we strive to deliver expectational results to achieve our vision to be the most respected property company in Australia. We do this by empowering our people to take initiative and create solutions. We believe our commitment to invest in you is what strengthens the core of our business and keeps us sustainable, focussed and passionate about shaping the future of property in Australia.

Your Opportunity

Working closely with the Divisional Finance Manager you will be across a diverse range of general property financing activities. This role is in a unique position to learn core asset finance instruments and develop and hone key accounting skills. You will be an interested and engaged team member with adroit communication skills.

As Property Accountant your key responsibilities will include;

  • Provide all reporting on time per the monthly finance timetable.
  • Preparation of the month end workbooks, including accruals and base rent reconciliations.
  • Administer the capital expenditure workbook and process, including review of actuals to budget/forecast, accruals and set up and closure of jobs as advised.
  • Completion of balance sheet reconciliations with appropriate detail and explanation of balances.
  • Investigation and commentary on aged or unusual accruals, purchase orders or financial transactions to ensure compliance/comply with financial controls.
  • Process any other month end adjustments as instructed by the Divisional Finance Manager.
  • Manage the calculation of outgoings wash-ups and accruals, forecasted outgoings adjustments and preparation of statements.

What will make you stand out?

To make you stand out from the crowd your skills and experience will ideally meet the below selection criteria.

  • 2+ years of experience in property accounting or similar
  • Degree (Bachelor of Commerce or equivalent)
  • CA/CPA qualified (or near completion)
  • Strong communication and analytical skills
  • Attention to detail and accuracy
  • Ability to multi-task, plan and manage tight deadlines

What makes us stand out?

  • Awarded Employer of Choice 2018
  • Commitment to diversity and inclusion
  • Broad spectrum of diverse and challenging career opportunities available across the organisation
  • Investment in your personal development and future career aspirations
  • Flexible work options available to all GPT employees
  • Competitive remuneration packages and employee benefits

We recognise that providing our people with flexible working options improves our performance, supports wellbeing and improves our lives outside of work. Our mobile workplace technologies and activity based work environments make working at GPT what you do, not where you do it. Explore your options to achieve flexibility including: generous paid parental leave, tailored hours and flexible scheduling, career breaks, study leave, compressed hours, remote working and leave purchase plans.

What are the next steps?

If the above sounds like out then we’d love to hear from you! Click the below link to submit your formal application online and a member of the talent team will be in touch.

Contact the job poster

Siobhan Convey (n\xe9e Worley)

Talent Acquisition at The GPT Group

Job description

The Company
 Broadspectrum is an operations, maintenance and construction services organisation, operating globally in the resources, energy, industrial, infrastructure, rail, property and defence sectors. This is a complex and evolving business offering the high profile projects, large-scale challenges and tailored support you need to achieve on the global stage.

The Role
 Broadspectrum are currently seeking an experienced and qualified Finance Administrator in a fulltime, fixed term position. This is a site based role at the Exxon Mobil - Altona Plant and the primary function will be Payroll Administration with secondary support for Procurement and other Finance related functions for the shutdown starting in early September.

The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to:

  • Manage end to end payroll process
  • Daily processing of staff timesheets
  • Process payroll transfers, reclassifications and terminations
  • Data transfers to client system
  • Payroll enquiries
  • Comply with site policies and procedures

Successful Applicant Skills and Experience

  • Experienced Payroll Administrator
  • Demonstrated attention to detail
  • Excellent computer skills including SAP, Excel, Access and word processing software.
  • Demonstrated interpersonal communication skills and the ability to work as a member of team.
  • Ability to work flexibel hours to meet job demands

To Apply
 Please visit the Careers section of our website or Click “APPLY” to forward your application CV, along with copies of your trade qualifications and proof of Citizenship.
We acknowledge the importance of our people’s diverse experiences, talents and cultures that they bring to work with them each day. The creation of a Diverse and Inclusive workforce is central to our ability to unlock potential and enhance our success, creating a high-performance business.
